comment: Chemical scent, but pleasant enough sweet, maple syrupy flavor
Sweet, perhaps honey and caramel, maybe maple. Alright but finish fade really quick
It’s kind of sweet and watery tasting
Very sweet, a little thin, but overall pretty good

Smells initially like ethanol and acetone. Fairly strongly, too much for just 40% ABV. Eventually you’ll catch some vanilla. 

Taste is much more subtle, mostly vanilla flavors, a little maraschino cherry. Maybe a slight spice. But it’s one of those whiskys that don’t have much flavor. 

Somehow this was $50 per bottle at the time and location of purchase, should never be more than $25.
Sweet, with a nose of vanilla, maple, and brown sugar. Taste was similar, very sweet and easy to drink.

I'm a recent transplant to Oregon & have decided to try the local brews & whiskey... I was introduced to the Pendleton by my brilliant neighbor...he loves it, albeit with water...I tried it neat...very smooth, but lacking considerably in depth. If this is a blend of fine Canadian whisky, then I've missed the idea. The price is good for your next party, but to enjoy with a good Alec Bradley, not worthy
If you're put off at first by the syrupy flavor and the annoying aftertaste, don't worry. You can add a few rocks and have a syrupy, flavorless drink with an annoying aftertaste.
Drank a lot of this with skydiving friends over the years. Easy to drink!
My favorite Canadian whiskey. Smooth, just the slightest bite to keep it interesting. Served on ice. Great to keep on hand, as most will enjoy, and few have tried it before.
Had at Kevin's house for bb game.  Smooth.  Taste of cherry syrup in chocalates
Tastes of vanilla but a lingering medicial taste. Just okay. I perhaps should have just left this at the cocktail level versus drinking straight.
My go to Canadian whisky for mixing and occasionally sippin'.
Very decent blend,better with a splash or a single ice cube!

Take two drops of maple syrup. Whisk into cold water. I have just given you the mash bill for this bottle. My father tried to pawn his opened-but-two-fingers-low bottle on me as a great mixing whiskey, but I get the distinct feeling he was making room in his cabinet for another bottle of Blantons. Thankfully, I have friends who enjoy their whiskey with a can of coke, so the bottle didn't go wasted.
Medicinal tasting, sharp bite, it was a surprise bottle from a friend. I wouldn't buy this for myself.
Sweet aged caramel. Big body, moderate bite, strong warm.
Very smooth, but not surprising for a Canadian.  Somewhat medicinal - vanilla extract and maple syrup.  Nothing harsh or distracting, but not an intriguing taste.
The worst non-scotch whiskey I have ever tasted (out of 50, primarily bourbon and rye whiskies).
Gourmet Chicago, not sure of blend
First noticed a chemical taste, followed by not much of an aftertaste. It tastes watered down. Pretty much only suited for a mixer...
Whiskey from Chris's Wedding recommended by Jeremy Poppin. Great taste for the price.
Silky smooth.  No burn.  Nice balance and not overpowering.  A nice sipper when you're looking for something not too complicated.
Definitely sweet. Has some rye to add a little character. For the price it's pretty decent, but I doubt I'd pick up another bottle.
Smooth, like going down on a metrosexual.  I prefer bears.  Grrrrr
Sweet. Light. Soapy. Good for cocktails. Not very complex
The vanilla is incredibly overpowering. I feel like you might as well just mix vanilla extract, water, and a bland whiskey. One of my least favorites I've had
I don’t like it. Not much flavor. No finish. 2 stars cause it’s not absolutely terrible. Maybe just not my kind. I’ll stick to my bourbons.
Slightly sweet.  Tastes a lot like Crown Royal.
Sweet with heavy notes of vanilla and maple syrup. A light finish that is somewhat floral but quickly disappears.
Sweet, unusually sweet, with no finish (not in a bad way). Probably a nice occasional drink, but too sweet to enjoy regularly.
sample/relatively smooth vs other Canadian whiskeys; sweet & floral

If you enjoy huffing Elmer's glue with a hint of maple syrup you might enjoy this off-putting whisky. 

If you're looking for a cheap Canadian you're much better off with Crown Royal.

May 18, 2018 John brought back from a trip to Oregon after being introduced on a business trip

What a deal! 

Nail polish, hard on the nose. Sweet on the tongue. Lots going on but not overpowering. Grassy, herbal and sweet.
redvine licorice, butterscotch, vanilla, medium bodied

Smells like vanilla rubbing alcohol. Once I get past the smell, it isn’t horrible, actually smoother than I would have thought. Very similar to crown royal but tons of vanilla, probably the strongest vanilla taste I have ever had in a whisk(e)y. At this price point though, it is really hard to complain.
First rating. This is too smooth. I love it though. About to finish my first bottle.
Has an interesting almost cola taste. Like Vanilla Coke. 8/8/16.
very strong glue or paint fumes smell with high sweet taste  strong and stringy but quick

AROMA/ Alcohol, Solents, Caramel, Sweetness, Candy
FIRST SIP/ Alcohol, Butter, Butterscotch
TASTE/ Grain, Butterscotch, Molasses, Alcohol warming
FINISH/ Smooth and buttery straight through with lingering butterscotch and hints of molasses.
80 proof

This would me good for mixers and can be drank neat or on the rocks.
It’s kind of a butterscotch bomb, too sweet, with a lack of any depth whatsoever.  Forgettable
Had in old fashioned so flavor wasn’t pure but not
Not great.  I tasted pepper and a chemical smell.  I just didn’t like at all.
Thin, but sweet and balanced with minimal burn. I taste caramel. A bit of barrel burn but the balance is really good.

Appearance: The color shines out of the glass as a pale gold. The legs are thin and watery.

Nose: The nose is both sweet and funky and both sides seem to fight for dominance. Notes of vanilla, caramel, pancakes with maple syrup, marigolds among other garden flowers fight with craft glue and a strange metallic note. 

Taste: There is not much going on as far as the palate is concerned except for it's clearly meant to be sweet. Notes of honeysuckle, cheap thin syrup, overripe strawberries, and something like pine sap cover the palate.

Finish: The finish is short, thin, and easy going down with no burn. There is also a aftertaste reminiscent of cornbread for me.

Thoughts: Well, this Canadian blend was good to try. I'm not disappointed but I'm not impressed either. I think it would be good as a mixer whisky and maybe over ice, but neat it wasn't my cup of tea, or, glass of whisky. The website, as a side note, can also use some work. It was very vague and said pretty generic things like it being actually aged in oak! ...Well no duh, that's every whiskey out there! (Besides moonshine) Anyways, off my rant. It's worth trying, but not falling in love with. Cheers!
Smooth. Not at all spicy for a rye. Rye flavor is subtle. 3.5 rating if that was possible
Not smoky like the liquor store employee said. But still very good
I don't get the chemical smell noted in the pro review, definitely sweet and a casual sip, not bad for the price point.

Very sweet, but not out of line. Typical Canadian,  but above average blend of flavors.  Sweet front, light rye middle, nice spicy ending. Might be too light for lovers of Canadian blends but nice for everyone else looking for a light blended whiskey.

Tasted 5/29/19 sample bottle

Don't be fooled by the description of sweet easy sippin whisky. There isn't much sweetness and it's nowhere close to being drinkingable neat. I took a few sips and decided to discard it. If you had no other choice i guess you can mix it with a soda for mask the bad flavor. Choose a better inexpensive bottle other than this one.
A fruity whiskey that would be good in a mixed drink. Sweet with no aftertaste.

There is an interesting aroma on the nose, mainly grape juice and cedar. The palate is sweet with some cinnamon and spice. Finish is short and dry. 

A decent Canadian whiskey for 89 cents per 50ml. Not as enjoyable as most scotches but I certainly prefer this to Crown Royal.

Nose, butterscotch and ethanol
Taste, sweet, like toffee and sugar syrup, with a lingering finish of rubbing alcohol
